title: SAD's Amritsar dist head Upkar Sandhu resigns from all posts
text:
Tribune News Service
Amritsar, October 24
In yet another embarrassing development for the Badal government, Punjab Energy Development Agency (PEDA) chairman and SAD's Amritsar district chief (urban) Upkar Singh Sandhu on Saturday resigned from both posts. Sandhu, considered a close confidante of the Badal family, cited the decision of the Five Takht Jathedars to exonerate Dera Sirsa chief and the recent incidents of desecration of Guru Granth Sahib in the state as reasons for his decision. Takht’s Jathedar’s decision, which he claimed was “influenced by politics alone”, had humiliated Sikh the world over. He also held the state government “solely” responsible for the increasing incidents of the desecration of ‘birs’ in the state. “Had the police taken cognisance when the first instance of sacrilege at Burj Jawahar Singh Wala village, Faridkot, came to light, the present situation could have been averted. What was the point of announcing awards of Rs 1 crore to find the culprits now? My conscience didn’t allow me to be part of this degrading political game. So, I decided to stay away and sent my resignations,” he said.
